title: hdf5 install check failure
body:
While trying to install hdf5 I see below error : 

```
make[1]: Leaving directory `/tmp/kumbhar/spack-stage/spack-stage-a_bGUR/hdf5-1.8.15/hl'
Checking HDF5 installation...
==> '/usr/bin/cc' '-c' '-I/home/kumbhar/SPACK_INSTALL/install/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/hdf5-1.8.15-qogppfgr52yh7splcf77xjbsdat63oe3/include' 'check.c'
==> '/usr/bin/cc' '-o' 'check' 'check.o' '-L/home/kumbhar/SPACK_INSTALL/install/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/hdf5-1.8.15-qogppfgr52yh7splcf77xjbsdat63oe3/lib' '-L/home/kumbhar/SPACK_INSTALL/install/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/hdf5-1.8.15-qogppfgr52yh7splcf77xjbsdat63oe3/lib64' '-lhdf5' '-lz'
==> './check'
./check: error while loading shared libraries: libhdf5.so.10: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
Produced output does not match expected output.
Expected output:
```

The `package.py` has:

```
            if '+mpi' in spec:
                cc = which('%s' % spec['mpi'].mpicc)
            else:
                cc = which('cc')
            # TODO: Automate these path and library settings
            cc('-c', "-I%s" % join_path(spec.prefix, "include"), "check.c")
```

The problem is obvious due to library paths. Wondering if using `spack_cc` will help for rpath.

Also, if I am building on cross compiling environment, instead of adding check for every platform cray, bg-q etc, is there any way to say `don't run test if I am cross-compiling`? 

P.S. I am using bit older version of spack but it should not matter.
